result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Activity:  Bail/bond hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:33 PM   Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek Melvin Meligan appeared by video.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Derek Melvin Meligan.  Court modifies bond condition to no contact with victim other than supervised visits through CPS.  Defendant must sign bond by August 26, 2022.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, otherwise for child visitation supervised by CPS. Must remain in residence between 6 PM and 6 AM except while at work or traveling to and from work.

Activity: initial appearance

03:05 PM  Defendant Derek Melvin Meligan in court, in custody appearing by video and Attorney Ryan O'Hara appearing by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500.00   with conditions, No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Must remain in residence between 6 PM and 6 AM except while at work or traveling to and from work. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance May 18, 2022 at 1:00 pm.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Must remain in residence between 6 PM and 6 AM except while at work or traveling to and from work.
